data.title: Without a Trace to Debut on Escape Jan. 1, 2018 With 12-Hour New Year's Day Marathon
data.meta_description: /PRNewswire/ -- Escape has acquired the rights to the popular drama series Without a Trace in a multi-year licensing agreement with Warner Bros. Domestic...
data.text:
ATLANTA, Dec. 6, 2017 /PRNewswire/ -- Escape has acquired the rights to the popular drama series Without a Trace in a multi-year licensing agreement with Warner Bros. Domestic Television Distribution (WBDTD).

Escape will launch Without a Trace on New Year's Day with a 12-episode marathon starting at 12 Noon ET. The series will be seen weeknights with two episodes back-to-back 9:00 - 11:00 p.m. ET starting Tues. Jan. 2.

Without a Trace will be Escape's first scripted drama series. It joins and expands a programming mix of original and acquired docuseries and theatrical motion pictures anchored in stories of investigation and mystery. Escape reaches women 25-54 and is currently seen in 90 percent of the U.S.

The multiple-award winning Without a Trace follows an FBI team based in New York City tasked with finding missing persons, with each episode following the search of an individual while tracking the time they've been missing. The stories also focus on the personal lives of the team members and illustrated how their experiences gave them insight into cases. Without a Trace stars Anthony LaPaglia, Poppy Montgomery, Marianne Jean-Baptiste, Enrique Murciano, Roselyn Sanchez and Eric Close. The series was produced by Jerry Bruckheimer and ran on CBS for seven seasons.

Escape is part of Katz Networks; targeted, demo-specific brands leading a new generation of fast-growing broadcast networks created to serve cord-cutters, cord-nevers and subscription-video-on-demand (SVOD) subscribers. Katz networks include: Bounce, the first and only African-American broadcast network, Grit, which targets men 25-54 with a lineup of western, action movies and series and Laff, the nation's first over-the-air network devoted to comedy around-the-clock. The Katz networks are part of The E.W. Scripps Company (NYSE: SSP).

Contact: Jim Weiss, 770-672-6504, [email protected]
